description.narrative: The Project seeks to provide long term financing to the City of Zaporizhzhia (the City) to support a comprehensive package of initiatives focusing mainly on improving energy efficiency, transport logistics, municipal infrastructure development and deployment of innovative and sustainable technologies to improve urban transport and other infrastructure programs. The financing will be used for (i) procurement of e-buses, trolleybuses, and related infrastructure, (ii) reconstruction of traction substations, (iii) procurement of IoT sensors and smart city infrastructure, (iv) procurement of road construction and cleaning equipment, (v) reconstruction of a street, and (vi) public park development. The project is expected to be supported by the Clean Technology Fund (CTF).

The project supports an investment program aimed at modernizing and improving efficiency of urban infrastructure in the city of Zaporizhzhia in Ukraine, with implications on access, quality and safety of service. The Project will modernize and improve public transport operations, as well as overhaul a street. This will improve the quality and safety of public transport. IFC expects the investment program to also contribute to lowering emissions, from introduction of new trolleybuses with autonomous running systems, updating rolling stock to more ecological standards, and providing stable energy supply to charging stations for e-buses and electric transport. Through IFC's advisory services, this engagement improves access to finance, by helping the City to establish a credit rating. At a market level, the Project pilots an IFC "Smart City" approach that improves competitiveness of the city, and could evolve into a scalable product and solution, with potential demonstration effects in Ukraine and other countries in the region. The Project also contributes to improve mobility and connectivity of the city's transportation network.
